intro: Orchyllium quelchii, commonly known as the New Zealand orchid, is a rare and endemic plant species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Orchyllium quelchii is considered a conservation concern.
